div.p: This tag is associated with WRITING RECEPTION . It encloses information about literary awards and prizes, and such marks of honour as statues, plaques, or things named after an author. These awards might be explained descriptively, or (only if your material calls for it) through one of two affiliated sub-elements, RRECOGNITIONNAME and RRECOGNITIONVALUE. The title of the award may be captured in RRECOGNITIONNAME, its value in monetary or numerical terms in RRECOGNITIONVALUE. There are no other mandatory or optional sub-elements or attributes for RRECOGNITIONS.

div.codeblock: <HEADING><RRECOGNITIONS>One of Anne Grant's late efforts was awarded the gold medal of the <ORGNAME>Highland Society</ORGNAME>.</HEADING>
<HEADING><RRECOGNITIONS>Annie Proulx won the <RRECOGNITIONNAME> Pulitzer</RRECOGNITIONNAME> for Shipping News in 1994.</RRECOGNITIONS></HEADING>
<RRECOGNITIONS>Hannah More was presented with a version of her poem written in Cingalese on palm leaves and beautifully boxed.</RRECOGNITIONS>

div.p: Like RPENALTIES, these results or consequences should be event-centred and should not discuss individual reviews or overall movements.
